intro: Callicarpa arborea, commonly known as the redberry tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its clusters of small, bright red berries that persist on the plant throughout the winter. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. The berries are not only ornamental but also serve as a food source for various wildlife species.
